title: Linux nslookup Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the nslookup command in Linux, learn how to perform basic DNS lookups, and troubleshoot DNS issues effectively.

meta.title: Linux nslookup Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the nslookup command in Linux, learn how to perform basic DNS lookups, and troubleshoot DNS issues effectively.
meta.keywords: Linux, nslookup, DNS, networking, troubleshooting, domain name resolution

verify.name: Verify nslookup command usage
verify.hint: Make sure the nslookup command is available on your system and that you can perform a basic DNS lookup for the google.com domain.

steps.title: Performing Basic DNS Lookups with nslookup

verify.name: Verify basic DNS lookup
verify.hint:
Make sure you can perform the following DNS lookups using nslookup:
1. Look up the IP address for the example.com domain
2. Retrieve all DNS records for the example.com domain
3. Perform a reverse DNS lookup for the 8.8.8.8 IP address

verify.name: Verify DNS troubleshooting with nslookup
verify.hint:
Make sure you can perform the following DNS troubleshooting tasks using nslookup:
1. Simulate a DNS resolution failure for a non-existent domain
2. Perform a DNS lookup using a specific DNS server (8.8.8.8)
3. Identify the DNS servers responsible for the example.com domain
